intro: Quadrella indica, commonly known as the Indian quadrella, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features slender, branched stems. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a strong, spicy scent when crushed. The roots and leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and digestive properties.
